_meanings:
{@--5@} Single of its kind, unique,
singular.

{@--8@} One of two or many;
<ls>Me. 30</ls>, <ls n="Me.">78.</ls>

a separate part,
part in general.

a vocabulary of 
monosyllabic words by 
Purushottamadeva.

the production of only
one syllable, contraction.

{1}
fixed on one object or point only.

(in <ab>Math.</ab>) the whole of the
long side of a figure which
is subdivided.

intentness of purpose, 
concentration of mind.

{%<ab>a.</ab>%} fixing
one's eye on one spot.

{1} a single member or part.
{2} sandal wood. 
{3} the head.

the only (day) 
receiving no part of the moon, an
epithet of Kuhū or day of new
moon (born together with Kṛṣṇa
and worshipped with Kṛṣṇa and
Baladeva and identified with Durgā).

{1} left as a funeral feast
or one who has recently partaken in
it.

a funeral ceremony 
performed for only one ancestor (recently
dead).

{3} directed 
towards one point or object only.

{1} a lonely or retired place, solitude;
{#vyoma° vihAriRaH#} <ls>Pt. 2. 20</ls>; <ls>H. 1. 52.</ls>

{3} an invariable
rule or course of conduct or 
action; <ls>Pt. 3. 7.</ls>

‘containing exclusively good years’, a
division of time with Jainas.

next but one, separated
by one remove; <ls>Ś. 7. 27</ls>; <ls>V. 1.</ls>

{1} passable for only
one (as a foot-path).

{2} fixing
one's thoughts on one object, 
closely attentive, intent; see {#ekAgra#}.

{1} having one and
the same meaning, having the
same object in view; <ls>Śi. 2. 114.</ls>

{1} the same thing, object,
or intention.

made up
of the same components.

{1} the first
or chief Aṣṭakā after the full
moon.

{2} the eighth day of the
dark fortnight in the month of
Māgha (on which a {#SrAdDa#} is to be
performed).

{2} a sacrifice
lasting for one day.

one substitute for two or
more letters (got by either 
dropping one vowel, or by the 
blending of both); as the {#A#} in  
{#ekAyana#}.

(a relative) 
connected by the offering of funeral
libations of water to the same 
deceased ancestor; <ls>Ms. 5. 71.</ls>

, {%<ab>ind.</ab>%} one
by one, singly, severally;  
<ls>Ś. 6. 11</ls>; {#°kaM nirdiSan#} <ls>Ś. 7</ls> pointing to each
severally.

consisting of or 
contained in one cup.

{1} acting in concert with, 
cooperating, having made common
cause with; co-worker; {#asmABiH#} 
{#sahEkakAryARAM#} <ls>Mu. 2</ls>; <ls>R. 10. 40.</ls>

{%<ab>ind.</ab>%} at one time, at one and the
same time.

eating but one
meal in any given time.

<ab>N.</ab> of Kubera; of Balabhadra:
and Śeṣa.

a
spiritual brother (pupil of the same
preceptor).

{%<ab>m.</ab>%} sole master of the whole
universe, universal monarch.

{4}
going together or at the same time.

{2} going alone or with one 
follower only.

thinking of one thing only, 
absorbed in one object.

referring to in the singular
number.

a brother or sister of the same
parents.

{2} belonging to
the same family or caste.

of the same kind
or family.

the chord of an arc:
sine of 30°.

concentrated or 
fixed on one object only, closely
attentive; {#brahmEkatAnamanaso hi#} 
{#vasizWamiSrAH#} <ls>Mv. 3. 11.</ls>

{1} 
attention fixed on one object only.

harmony, accurate adjustment of
song, dance, and instrumental music
(<ab>cf.</ab> {#tOryatrikaM#}).

an instrument
for beating time, any instrument
having but one note.
{1} bathing in the same holy water.

{2} belonging to the same religious
order; <ls>Y. 2. 137.</ls>

a kind of sacrifice 
performed in or lasting for a day.

<ab>N.</ab> of a class of 
Sannyāsins or beggars (otherwise called
{#haMsa#}). They are divided into four 
orders: --{#kuwIcako bahudako haMsaScEva tftIyakaH .#}
{#caturTaH parahaMsaSca yo yaH paScAtsa uttamaH ..#} <ls>Hārīta</ls>.

living in the same region or
quarter.

sympathising,
having the same joys and sorrows.

{1} a crow.
{2} <ab>N.</ab> of Śiva. 
{3} a philosopher.

the sole object of vision,
alone being worthy of being seen.

devoted, directed, or
offered to one deity.

{2} a part or portion
(of the whole), one side; {#°avatIrRA#}
<ls>K. 22</ls>; {#tasyEkadeSaH#} <ls>U. 4</ls>; <ls>Mv. 2</ls>;  
{#viBAvitEkadeSena deyaM yadaBiyujyate#} <ls>V. 4. 17</ls>
‘what is claimed should be given
by one who is proved to have got
a part of it’; (this is sometimes called
{#ekadeSaviBAvitanyAya#}).

consisting of parts or portions, divided
into parts.

a kind of jug
with which water is taken up at
certain religious ceremonies.

{1} possessing the same properties,
of the same kind.

{1} fit for but one kind of
labour.

a lunar mansion
consisting of only one star.

the principal actor in a drama, the
manager ({#sUtraDAra#}) who recites the
prologue.

come
to the same conclusion or resolution,
having the same aim.

{1} intently devoted or
loyal (to one thing).

{1} of the
same side or party, an associate.

{2} the wife of a man who has
no other wives; <ls>Ms. 5. 158.</ls>

a foot-path
(for a single man to walk on).

{2} 
consisting of or named in one word.

{3} the time required to
pronounce a single word.

a verse consisting of only
one Pāda or quarter stanza.

{2} a
Gāyatrī consisting of one Pāda.

<ab>Ved.</ab> an epithet of the dice
in which one is decisive or of 
preeminent importance.

one
over or under, (a term at dice; <ab>cf.</ab>
{#akzapari#}).

{1} <ab>N.</ab> of a younger
sister of Durgā. 
{2} <ab>N.</ab> of Durgā.
{3} a plant having one leaf only.

<ab>N.</ab> of a younger sister of
Durgā.

{%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} {#fk#} a verse
to be taken by itself or 
independently of the hymn to which it belongs.

a kind of
posture of birds.

<ab>N.</ab>
of Kubera, having a yellow mark
in place of one eye; (his eye was
so made on account of a curse
uttered by Pārvatī when he cast
an evil eye at her).

united by the offering of the 
funeral rice-ball;

<ab>N.</ab> of
a religious ceremony; eating but
one meal (a day).

eating but
once a day as a religious observance.
eating but one meal a day.

of
the same or one nature.

{2} unanimous, thinking in
the same way.

{1} having the
face directed towards one place or
object.

{4} having
one door or entrance (as a {#maMqapa#}).

{2} of the same
family or caste; <ls>Ms. 9. 148.</ls>

{1} finding
pleasure only in one thing, of one
flavour; <ls>R. 10. 17.</ls>

{3} of one tenor, stable,
equable; <ls>Māl. 4. 7</ls>; <ls>U. 4</ls>, <ls n="U.">15.</ls>

{1} oneness of aim or feeling.
{2} the only flavour or pleasure.

lasting
or sufficient for one night only.

{1} of one
form or kind, like, similar; <ls>Ki. 8. 2</ls>,
<ls n="Ki.">9. 55.</ls>
{1} a word having one gender only.

{4} involving the use of one letter
({#°samIkaraRa#}).

an equation 
involving one unknown quantity.

having only
one garment, in one dress.

consistency in meaning, 
unanimity, reconciling different statements.

{1} a kind of drum or 
tabor.

a rival
(having a common object or end
in view).

{2} a district in which
but one tree is seen for 4 Krośas.

{1} a peculiar
disease of the throat.

an animal
whose hoof is not cloven (as a horse,
ass &c.).

the sole recourse
or refuge (especially applied to a
deity).

of one body or
blood, consanguineous.

a descendant in a right line,
blood-kinsman.

commencement of consanguinity by the
union of father and mother.

a
Brāhmaṇa of the same branch or
school.

‘the
remainder of one’, a species of 

Dvandva compound in which one
of two or more words only is 
retained; {%<ab>e. g.</ab>%} {#pitarO#} father and
mother, parents, (= {#mAtApitarO#}); so
{#SvaSurO, BrAtaraH#} &c.

{%<ab>a.</ab>%} keeping in mind what one
has heard once.

<ab>N.</ab> of a small
double drum played by a string
and ball attached to the body of it.

{1} being or centred in one
place; <ls>Ku. 1. 49</ls>; <ls>Me. 104</ls> <ab>v. l.</ab>

one or the same
place; {#ekasTAne prasUte vAk#} <ls>Pt. 4. 5.</ls>

the chief or highest Haṃsa
(an allegorical designation of the
soul).
